abstract: A more casual dining room moves to the front of the house.
snippet: A more casual dining room moves to the front of the house.
lead_paragraph: Hakan Swahn and his partner, the chef Marcus Jernmark, have reconfigured their Nordic restaurant, Aquavit. What was the cafe area in the front is now the main restaurant, and though the furnishings include Swedish classics like Arne Jacobsen chairs, it is less formal than the previous dining room, which was in the back and is now for private parties. There are four- and seven-course prix-fixe menus for dinner, à la carte or three courses at lunch. Traditional Swedish specialties like herring dishes will now be served from late afternoon through evening in the bar and lounge.
